channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+4362] VLC 1.0.0 Released!
item.description: The VideoLAN project is pleased to announce the release of the first version of the Goldeneye branch of VLC: 1.0.0. This major release introduces many new features, new formats and new codecs to the VLC multimedia framework and fixes a very high number of bugs that were present in the 0.9.x or 0.8.6 versions.

item.title: [+2579] Official Google Blog: Google Apps is out of beta (yes, reall
item.description: Gmail, Google Docs, Google Calendar, and Google Talk are out of beta!

item.title: [+2279] Toyota Employees Taped Watching Porn In Customers Truck
item.description: The first two times Jason brought his truck in to his local Toyota dealership for service, he noticed that someone had taken quarters from his change compartment. He complained both times, but was ignored. So the third time he brought his truck in, he placed a video camera on the passenger side. The dealership didn't ignore him this time.

item.title: [+2078] Last Words From Death Row Inmates [PICS]
item.description: Some of these statements are startling, some are deep. Others are about as shallow as the kiddie pool. Every one of these prisoners was executed just after saying a few final words.

item.title: [+1758] Uncovered: 350-year-old picture of dodo before it was extinc
item.description: A previously undiscovered 17th century picture of a dodo, drawn before the bird became extinct, is to be sold at auction.

item.title: [+1592] Televangelist builds $4M home despite layoffs at his church
item.description: Inspiration Networks' CEO David Cerullo is building a $4 million home in a gated, lakefront community in western South Carolina at the same time that the ministry has cut jobs and reset thermostats to save money in its new headquarters.

item.title: [+1534] President Obama's first 167 days (PICS)
item.description: U.S. President Barack Obama has now been in office for 167 days, and it's time for a look back. Why 167 days? Why not - it's just as arbitrary a number as the usual "100 days". In that time, President Obama has contended with stimulating the U.S. economy, reshaping U.S. policy abroad, and starting work on domestic issues such as health care reform.

item.title: [+1397] Limbaugh Goes Over Edge, Calls for Overthrow of U.S. Gov
item.description: WITH VIDEO - We knew when the incendiary rhetoric was ratcheted up very early in the Democratic administration that there was no where else for it to go but over the edge. Limbaugh took it there on Monday by calling for foreign assistance to overthrow the U.S. government.

item.title: [+1271] 10 Most Annoying Airline Passengers, As Told By a Flight Attendant
item.description: 9) Misuse of Overhead Compartments: If you're one of the first 10 passengers to board, shoving your jacket into the overhead bin is a total a-hole move. It's frustrating to have to check someone's carry-on because your jacket has taken up half the overhead bin when it could easily have gone under the seat in front of you

item.title: [+1222] Sheriff
[+1178] Arizona is 6000 years old? | Bad Astronomy | Discover Magazi
item.description: Antiscience | Ian O'Neill at Astroengine posted this stunning bit of video featuring Arizona State Senator Sylvia Allen. It's not that she says the Earth is 6000 years old --

item.title: [+1175] UK weapons inspector who was found dead 'was writing expose'
item.description: British weapons inspector Dr. David Kelly was writing an expose about his work with anthrax and his warnings that Iraq possessed no weapons of mass destruction at the time of his death in July 2003, according to a report published in a British newspaper.

item.title: [+1055] Is there life after death?
[+1013] A Virtual Tour of Michael Jackson's Arcade Room
[+968] New algorithm guesses SSNs using date and place of birth - A
item.description: Two researchers have found that a pair of antifraud methods intended to increase the chances of detecting bogus social security numbers has actually allowed the statistical reconstruction of the number using information that many people place on social networking sites.

item.title: [+910] What Your Tattoo Really Says About You
item.description: Tattoos are more popular than ever. People from nearly every social, cultural, and ideological background are using tattoos as a way to identify themselves to the world. But sometimes your tattoo can send a message that's different than what you intended. Here's what your tattoo is really saying about you.

item.title: [+893] Mary-Louise Parker Reads for You in Bed (vid)
item.description: Either the best video to get stoned to since the 60s, or the best video to fall asleep to since Disney was cool. Either way, it's Mary-Louise Parker from Weeds reading Alice in Wonderland. In her bed. In lingerie. With milk and cookies.

item.title: [+867] Fall Out for Real [PICS]
item.description: There are a lot of fans of “Fallout” game across the world. In Russia this electronic entertainment piece is widely recognized too. Sometimes the anticipation to game goes so strong that devoted people are trying to transfer the gameplay to real life, stating that some Russian abandoned locations are a perfect fit for an image of “New California”..

item.title: [+859] The Patriot's Guide to Legalization | Mother Jones
item.description: Have you ever looked at our marijuana policy? I mean, really looked at it?

item.title: [+847] A Timeline of Futuristic Movies (Poster)
item.description: No one really pays much attention to what year sci-fi movies take place. I thought it would be interesting to arrange some classic films about the future into chronological order and see what we’d find.
